de.bioforscher.singa.simulation.model.graphs

Class AutomatonGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.graphs.grid.AbstractGridGraph<AutomatonNode,AutomatonEdge,Vector2D>
      • de.bioforscher.singa.simulation.model.graphs.AutomatonGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph<AutomatonNode,AutomatonEdge,RectangularCoordinate>

    public class AutomatonGraph
extends AbstractGridGraph<AutomatonNode,AutomatonEdge,Vector2D>
    The Automaton graph class is the underlying graph of cellular graph automaton Simulations. Each AutomatonNode is placed in a two dimensional simulation space, neighbourhoods are defined by AutomatonEdges. Nodes can be assigned to groups using CellSections that emulate compartments, extracellular space or membranes.

      Creates a new empty graph, initialized with node and edge capacity.

        public int addEdgeBetween(int identifier,
                          AutomatonNode source,
                          AutomatonNode target)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Adds an edge with the given identifier between the two given nodes. If an edge with the identifier is already present in the graph it is overwritten.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the edge to be inserted.
        source - The source node.
        target - The target node.
        Returns:
        The identifier of the added edge.
